siat.dsl.data.acquisition.streaming.operations.client

Class KafkaMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • siat.dsl.data.acquisition.streaming.operations.client.KafkaMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class KafkaMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable

    SIAT Project

    Layer: Data Storage Layer: Streaming Acquisition

    Package Name: siat.dsl.data.acquisition.streaming.operations.client

    Class Name: KafkaMonitor

    Since:
    2018-27-11 It is the main API to monitor a Kafka cluster. It relies on KFClusterWatcher to make operations. It keeps Kafka cluster status which can be recovered by clients using getCluster() or creating a instance with a KFMonitorCallback listener.

    To start monitoring, users must call start(). Clients should call getCluster() to get kafka cluster representation and its status. Additionally, clients could construct an instance by passing a KFMonitorCallback instance to be notified when a kafka broker status has changed.

    The following example creates a kafka monitor instance and get the cluster health check. 

    

   public static void main(String[] args){
       final String kfHosts = "kafka-1:9092,kafka-2:9092,kafka-3:9092";
       final String zkHosts = "zookeeper-1:2181,zookeeper-2:2181,zookeeper-3:2181";
       KafkaMonitor kfMonitor = new KafkaMonitorBuilder(kfHosts,zkHosts)
               .withKafkaPollingInitialDelayTime(1000)
               .withKafkaPollingInitialDelayTime(0)
               .withZookeeperSessionTimeout(8000)
               .withKafkaMonitorListener(new KFMonitorCallback() {
                   public void onBrokerUp(String zkBrokerName) {}
                   public void onBrokerDown(String zkBrokerName) {}
               }).build();
       kfMonitor.start();
       final ZKClusterStatusName health = kfMonitor.getHealth();
       if(health == KFClusterStatusName.OK) {
           System.out.println("All Kafka brokers are up  and running");
       }
   }
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aftab Alam
    See Also:
    KFMonitorPollingStatusExample, KFMonitorPollingStatusExample

    • Constructor Detail

      • KafkaMonitor

        public KafkaMonitor(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> configuration,
                    KFMonitorCallback kfMonitorListener)
        Constructs an instance to monitors Kafka cluster and notify clients when broker status has changed

        Parameters:
        configuration - Map containing configuration properties. client.configuration.PropertyNames#KF_SERVERS property is required
        kfMonitorListener - KFMonitorCallback instance implemented by client that wants to be notified when kafka broker status has changed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when any argument is null or required configuration is missing

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        It starts Kafka cluster monitor.

        This method should be called after creating a KafkaMonitor instance and before calling any other method. Calling this method more than once does not have effect.

        Throws:
        streaming.operations.client.exception.ConnectionException - if zookeeper connection fails

      • getCluster

        public KFCluster getCluster()
        It returns a KFCluster instance that contains the current kafka cluster status and the list of brokers.
        Returns:
        KFCluster instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if KFClusterWatcher.start() method was not called.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        It stops kafka cluster monitoring.

        Once this method has been called, others methods will not work. Calling this method more than once does not have effect.

      • getHealth

        public KFClusterStatusName getHealth()
        Returns:
        KFClusterStatusName enum value that represents the current kafka cluster status

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Stop monitor using try-with-resources statement
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if cannot stop Kafka monitor
